The British weekly magazine GQ has announced the launch of an online magazine devoted to women artists. It will be hosted by the London-based artist-run collective Cultivate. The initiative, which will feature an open-ended format, will focus on exploring the work of British artists who are largely unknown to the public.“I’ve long been fascinated by the work of British women artists and their place in the world,” Samantha Bennington, the founder of Cultivate, told the Art Newspaper. “I’ve also long been a fan of the work of American women artists and their place in the world, and especially of the work of Sally Mann. I would have loved to see her work shown in the United States.”
